result.execSummary:
The defendant Deangelo P Winston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Court ordered the defendant to pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment: All court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA; All applicable fees of supervision. Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.
CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; **11-02-16 with 6 days of sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- No Contact with: Terrell Hall, Darryl Bonner, Javone Steele, Marvin Wynn, Orlando Walker and Robert Lewis Jr.
- No driving without valid license.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deangelo P Winston in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Deangelo P Winston in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Jesse Busshardt & Rosalinda Barajas.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  8 YEARS CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment.
- No contact with: Terrell Hall, Darryl Bonner, Javone Steele, Marvin Wynn, Orlando Walker and Robert Lewis Jr.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- No driving without valid license. 
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter.
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deangelo P Winston in court with Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Deangelo P Winston in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has three cases before the court.

Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

PSI not ordered.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.  Jury trial is vacated.
Defendant remanded pending sentencing.
